column1: Statins are medicines that help lower the amount of cholesterol and other fats in your blood.

Statins work by: - Lowering LDL, or bad, cholesterol - Raising HDL, or good, cholesterol in your blood - Lowering triglycerides, another type of fat in your blood Statins block how your liver makes cholesterol.
If this is not successful, medicines to lower cholesterol may be the next step.
Statins are often the first drug treatment for high cholesterol.
Both adults and teenagers can take statins when needed.
Pregnant and nursing mothers should not take statins.
Certain medications may interact with statins.
